Issues.Title: fix(docs-infra): upgrade to latest dgeni-packages to fix linking problem
Issues.Body:
This new version of dgeni-packages gives the main (implemented)
overload of a method the correct id and aliases, which allow it to be
automatically linked.

See https://github.com/angular/dgeni-packages/commit/398f35da303a839525cdb5aa690de394e905b1d5

Fixes #27820
Closes #27821
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(docs-infra): upgrade to latest dgeni-packages to fix linking problem" (#27864)

Issues.Title: Document that `whenStable` requires `await` within the test function
Issues.Body:
# 📚 Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

`whenStable` returns a promise.  If the test does not perform an `await` on the promise, any failure may be missed or propagate during `afterAll`.

## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction

It is difficult to reproduce this reliably because of the async nature.

### What's the affected URL?

https://angular.io/guide/testing#more-async-tests

### Reproduction Steps

Any test with a failure inside the `whenStable` block.

### Expected vs Actual Behavior

Success of the test instead of failure, especially when there are additional tests run after.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Document that `whenStable` requires `await` within the test function" (#27863)

Issues.Title: refactor(ivy): avoid `transitiveScopesFor` function duplication in TestBed
Issues.Body:
TestBed used to have its own implementation of the `transitiveScopesFor` function, customized for TestBed needs (to compile NgModules). This change unifies the `transitiveScopesFor` function usage by importing it from the `jit/module.ts` script and adding extra argument to configure its behavior (how to compile NgModule), so that TestBed can leverage it.

Corresponding ticket: FW-902.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(ivy): avoid `transitiveScopesFor` function duplication in TestBed" (#27860)

Issues.Title: feat(service-worker): add JSON schema for service worker config
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features) > I don't know how to test this
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features) (not relevant here) > not relevant


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Feature


## What is the current behavior?
No assistance/validation in editor for service worker config.

Issue Number: Fixes #19847 

With angular/angular-cli#13325, it will also fix angular/angular-cli#13324

## What is the new behavior?
Assistance/validation in editor for service worker config.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?
- [X] No

## Other information

The schema follows `@angular/service-worker` interfaces ([here](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/service-worker/config/src/in.ts)).

Descriptions come from the official documentation on angular.io ([here](https://angular.io/guide/service-worker-config)).

Default values have been verified in `@angular/service-worker` code ([here](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/f8096d499324cf0961f092944bbaedd05364eea1/packages/service-worker/config/src/generator.ts)).

I don't understand how the build works. When following the contributing guidelines, I can't see the static files that should be copied (like `safety-worker.js` and `schema.json`) in `dist` builds. **So this part have to be checked.**

As this is just an helper for development, this could be added in a patch version.

@gkalpak
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(service-worker): add JSON schema for service worker config" (#27859)

Issues.Title: @angular/elements creating is 7-10 times slower than native custom elements
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/elements ### Is this a regression? dunno ### Description Creating custom elements via @angular/elements is extremely slow. Simple test with ~600 components shows 7-10x slowdown related to native custom element. @angular/elements with NgZone, prod mode 180ms creation + 220ms of raf hell ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1944061/50519599-cb2f6d80-0acc-11e9-95a5-68bab76206fd.png) @angular/elements without NgZone, prod mode 180ms creation + short raf mini-hell ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1944061/50519530-725fd500-0acc-11e9-860e-172f2cecbb7d.png) native custom element 20ms creation ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1944061/50519553-80adf100-0acc-11e9-9df0-50e2640ecdcb.png) ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction @angular/elements without NgZone https://stackblitz.com/edit/content-assemble-angular-elements?file=app%2Fhello.component.ts for NgZone enabling comment out `{ ngZone: 'noop' }` in `main.ts` native custom elements https://stackblitz.com/edit/content-assemble-custom-elements?file=app%2Fhello.component.ts ## 🔥 Exception or Error ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

7.1.4
**Anything else relevant?** It's not a synthetic case, we have a real case with thousands of lessons slides that are created in separate cms as html markup with a lot of components/exercises (usually 500-2k components nodes per slide). Currently we are using old aio approach with manual createComponent calls on appropriate nodes and its faster than using @angular/elements (https://stackblitz.com/edit/content-assemble-html-v2?file=app%2Fapp.component.ts 80ms for same example).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "@angular/elements creating is 7-10 times slower than native custom elements" (#27858)

Issues.Title: feat(common): inject CURRENCY_ID in number_pipe constructor
Issues.Body:
change constructor to accept an injected CURRENCY_ID(similar to LOCALE_ID) and use it as a default when no currencyCode is provided, before 'USD' fallback.

Now currency code still is by default 'USD', but can be changed in a provider using provide and useValue:
```
  providers: [
      { provide: CURRENCY_ID, useValue: "EUR" },
  ],
```

Closes #25461, #22519

Issues.Title: Aot compiler breaking string concatination
Issues.Body:
Copied from https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/12258

<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)

```
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
<!--
Output from: `node --version`, `npm --version` and `ng --version`.
  Windows (7/8/10). Linux (incl. distribution). macOS (El Capitan? Sierra? High Sierra?)
-->
node: 
````
v10.5.0
````
npm: 
````
6.1.0
````
Angular:
````
Angular CLI: 6.0.8
Node: 10.5.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular:
...

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.6.8
@angular-devkit/core         0.6.8
@angular-devkit/schematics   0.6.8
@schematics/angular          0.6.8
@schematics/update           0.6.8
rxjs                         6.2.1
typescript                   2.7.2
````

### Repro steps
<!--
Simple steps to reproduce this bug.
Please include: commands run (incl args), packages added, related code changes.
A link to a sample repo would help too.
-->
1. create an Angular project
2. create a file which has a namespace with a const value：
src/app/const.ts
````
export namespace Const {
    export const Value = 'a';
}
````
3. create a lazy module, use the const value
src/app/a/a.module.ts
````
import { NgModule } from '@angular/core';
import { RouterModule } from '@angular/router';
import { Const } from '../const';

@NgModule({
  imports: [
    RouterModule.forChild([
      // BUG 
      { path: `${Const.Value}b` },
    ]),
  ]
})
export class AModule {
}
````
src/app/app.module.ts
````
import { BrowserModule } from '@angular/platform-browser';
import { NgModule } from '@angular/core';

import { AppComponent } from './app.component';
import { RouterModule } from '@angular/router';

@NgModule({
  declarations: [
    AppComponent
  ],
  imports: [
    BrowserModule,
    RouterModule.forRoot([
      {
        path: 'a',
        loadChildren: './a/a.module#AModule'
      },
    ]),
  ],
  providers: [],
  bootstrap: [AppComponent]
})
export class AppModule { }
````
4. run `ng build --prod`

### The log given by the failure
<!-- Normally this include a stack trace and some more information. -->

The output js file of AModule has wrong path value.
dist/<project_name>/0.fc3e9f73dd253ec7a2f8.js
````
(window.webpackJsonp=window.webpackJsonp||[]).push([[0],{KImX:function(n,t,a){"use strict";a.r(t);var c=a("CcnG"),o=function(){},r=a("pMnS"),u=a("ZYCi");a.d(t,"AModuleNgFactory",function(){return i});var i=c.Fa(o,[],function(n){return c.Na([c.Oa(512,c.j,c.V,[[8,[r.a]],[3,c.j],c.u]),c.Oa(1073742336,u.l,u.l,[[2,u.r],[2,u.k]]),c.Oa(1073742336,o,o,[]),c.Oa(1024,u.i,function(){return[[{path:"[object Object]b"}]]},[])])})}}]);
````
expect `{path:"ab"}` but result is `{path:"[object Object]b"}` 

### Desired functionality
<!--
What would like to see implemented?
What is the usecase?
-->


### Mention any other details that might be useful
<!-- Please include a link to the repo if this is related to an OSS project. -->
1. without "--prod" flag is correct
2. without namespace is correct
3. ` ${Const.Value}b ` and `Const.Value + 'b' ` are same

This is re-predicable using the ngc compiler directly.

//cc @fdragoon

Issues.Title: Add a mechanism to assure that the Angularjs app loads first in hybrid application
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->


# 🚀 feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: --> This feature request is for @angular/upgrade


### Description
All you can find about the migration incrementally to new Angular has been mentioned [here](https://angular.io/guide/upgrade) and many examples across the web which all mention to a little application that you can load the Angularjs file by script tag inside index.html and then bootstrap the app. In case that you have a big application more than 500,000 lines of code this approach won't work in any way and loading a bundle of old angularjs app too. If the bundle be huge, there is no way you be sure the angularjs has been loaded first and then Angular ngUpgrade bootstrap the app.


### Describe the solution you'd like
It would be great that there be a mechanism that you be able to load first the angularjs or somehow tell the angular app to wait first for Angularjs and then load the angular app and bootstrap it.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
I don't know if it is a good idea but In this case, I guess the only way is to change completely the building setup and customize it somehow by implementing Webpack instead of Angular-Cli (I'm still working on it) and build your app the way it will work.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add a mechanism to assure that the Angularjs app loads first in hybrid application " (#27844)

Issues.Title: Redirect to root url does not work when returning UrlTree from guard
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? No. ### Description I use a guard to protect a route. If the user is not allowed to access the route I'd like to redirect to the root url. I'm doing this by returning an UrlTree from the canActivate method. To get the UrlTree for the root url I'm calling router.parseUrl('/'). However when I navigate to the protected page the redirect to the root url does not happen. The protected page isn't displayed either and there are no errors in the console. If I change the guard to return router.parseUrl('/unauthorized') the redirect to the unauthorized page works as expected. I think this should also work for the root url. Am I missing something or is this a bug? ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction [https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-w72ytp](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-w72ytp) ## 🔥 Exception or Error None ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:**

```ts
], BrowserModule);
```

Issues.Title: new behavior for global ErrorHandler and uncaught errors from promises
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package Well I thought this was zone.js wrapping the errors, but I rolled zone back only zone and it didn't change. ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was 5.x ### Description Previously, unhandled errors from promises were handed to a custom error handler unchanged. But now, it seems the error is wrapped and you need to unwrap it to get the real error that's sitting on the "rejection" property of the error. The docs make no mention of this here https://angular.io/api/core/ErrorHandler and neither does any googling surprisingly. I noticed this only after upgrading from angular 5 to angular 7 and one of my e2e tests that relied on my general error handler started failing. The only workaround I found was to have something like this at the top of the error handler's handleError() method like this: ```typescript while(error.rejection) { error = error.rejection; } ``` but... 1. I'm quite sure there's a better way - now I have to type error as any 2. I'm not sure if there are any other situations that will require unwrapping (e.g. from observables?). Either way, if this was some kind of intentional feature, it's definitely a gotcha that I think should be mentioned (with the RIGHT way to handle it) in the doc link I pasted. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction 1. follow the docs and implement a global error handler and try to handle unhandled requests uniformly - something like this: ```typescript @Injectable() export class SpiffyErrorHandlerService implements ErrorHandler { constructor(private injector: Injector, private snackBar: MatSnackBar) {} public handleError(error: Error) { if (error instanceof HttpErrorResponse) { if (error.status === 401) { this.snackBar.open( 'Oops. It looks like you tried to access a logged-in resource while logged out. Please log in again.', '', { duration: 3000 } ); } } } ``` 2. inject HttpClient 3. await this.http.get('/some-404-returning-url').toPromise(); ## 🔥 Exception or Error EXPECTED: error handler works, gets the HttpErrorResponse, and shows the snackbar ACTUAL: the HttpErrorResponse is on error.rejection instead of right on error. ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Node: 10.14.2
OS: linux x64

### Mention any other details that might be useful
<!-- Please include a link to the repo if this is related to an OSS project. -->
@angular-devkit/build-angular 0.11.4 is has a fixed dependency on license-webpack-plugin 2.0.2.
license-webpack-plugin 2.0.2 has an issue https://github.com/xz64/license-webpack-plugin/pull/57 that causes the build to fail when if the guessed name is a folder instead of a file.
Issue has since been fixed in license-webpack-plugin as of 2.0.3.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Production build fails due to dependency on license-webpack-plugin 2.0.2" (#13329)

Issues.Title: Add flag for OnPush ChangeDetection
Issues.Body:
### Need to add flag for OnPush ChangeDetection and add it in angular.json

Issues.Title: Allow Port to be null in angular.json
Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [x] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```


### Desired functionality

The scenario I am talking about is this:

ng serve --host local-address

and omitting the port completly

i have edited my hosts file for definition of google.dev

Where local-address is on a private network and not accessibly directly from the web. In the above instance, you only need to add host to ng serve and the port is taken care internally by hosts file & nginx.

In this scenario, running the following

ng serve --host google.dev --disable-host-check

will load the page with default port which is not required and can be omitted as it is taken care internally by nginx.

### Mention any other details that might be useful

i have google.dev pointing to localhost in hosts file
`127.0.0.1   google.dev`

and in my nginx i do proxy pass
```
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name google.dev;
    location / {
        proxy_set_header   Host      $http_host;
        proxy_pass         http://127.0.0.1:4200;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
	proxy_connect_timeout       300;
	proxy_send_timeout          300;
	proxy_read_timeout          300;
	send_timeout                300;
    }
}

```

so this can be fixed if the port allowed null in angular.json

```
"projects": {
    "my-cool-project": {
        ... rest of project config omitted
        "architect": {
            "serve": {
                "options": {
                   "host": "google.dev"
                    "port": null // allowing null would load the url without port
                }
            }
        }
    }
}


```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow Port to be null in angular.json" (#13326)

Issues.Title: Installing/updating TypeScript 3.2 with CLI 7.2 is a breaking change
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report
```
- [x] bug report
```

### Command
```
- [x] new
```

### Versions
CLI v7.2.0-rc.0

### Repro steps
`ng new demoapp`

### The log given by the failure
Install TS 3.2, due to angular/angular-cli#13226

### Desired functionality
Should continue to install TS 3.1.

### Mention any other details that might be useful
Angular 7.0 and 7.1 supported TypeScript 3.1 only. Angular 7.2 now supports TypeScript 3.1 and TypeScript 3.2.

But **installing TypeScript 3.2 directly is a breaking change**, as it means a higher TypeScript version is required for the whole project.

Why? Because Angular 7.2 may support TS 3.2, but any real-world app will also rely on third-party libraries that may not be compatible with TS 3.2 yet, or even that can't be compatible with TS 3.2 (example: [one my lib is affected by a regression in TS 3.2](https://github.com/cyrilletuzi/angular-async-local-storage/issues/64)).

This is why Angular will only requires TS 3.2 (or newer) in the next *major* version, but still supports TS 3.1 in minor versions.

This is also confirmed by the CLI code itself which says [here](https://github.com/alan-agius4/angular-cli/blob/9ec504eb5d0b7559389c53ada4fa0bbbbfa3061b/packages/schematics/angular/utility/latest-versions.ts#L10):
```ts
// These versions should be kept up to date with latest Angular peer dependencies.
```

But Angular 7.2 `peerDependencies` is not TypeScript `~3.2.2`, it's `>=3.1.1 <3.3` (see [here](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/compiler-cli/package.json#L27)).

So the CLI may use the latest supported TS 3.2 internally, but should not install the latest one in the project.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Installing/updating TypeScript 3.2 with CLI 7.2 is a breaking change" (#13323)

Issues.Title: Angular CLI @7 Library Build path references
Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ x] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [ ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x ] build
- [ x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
ng: 7.1.4
Node: 10.13.0
OS: Win 10 x64 

### Repro steps
1. Scaffold a new Angular CLI project with the @7 generator.
2. Generate a new Library using the subgenerator: **ng g library libraryname --prefix=xx**
3. Add a Typings file (**index.d.ts**) under the lib folder of the library
4. Add a global namespace declaration into the Typings file
5. Add a path reference to this Typings file 
6. Run the build command for the project: **ng build libraryname**
7. Open the dist folder and then the subfolder with the name of the library.
8. The index.d.ts Typings file will appear within the lib folder, but under the esm5 and esm2015 folders, the public_api.js files contain references to the Typings file which the path is invalid, as these are within a sub folder.

Alternativley, you can add the Typings file right next to the public_api.ts file and add the references, and the paths will still be incorrect.


### The log given by the failure
No Error on build, but on serve I recieve:
ERROR ReferenceError: atlas is not defined.

### Desired functionality
Although this is a Global Namespace inside the typings file, and the Intellisense on VS Code picks it up without having to add any new references in the main application for testing, upon serving the project to test the library, the project is not able to find the namespace.


### Mention any other details that might be useful
You can clone and run [this project](https://github.com/xavidram/AtlasTypingsIssue.git) to see the error.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular CLI @7 Library Build path references" (#13318)

Issues.Title: revert: fix(@ngtools/webpack): emit lazy routes errors on rebuilds
Issues.Body:
This reverts commit edb84b340ff996df2ca6a2aaf765304cc64fef3e

The team has decided to bring back the faster but potentially less accurate method of detecting lazy routes upon JIT rebuilds (first builds will always use the more complete Angular compiler method). Applications that do not have lazy routes within libraries and that only use direct string literals with loadChildren should not be affected by the potential of less accurate detection. Note that the function overload of loadChildren also does not apply to this situation.

For those projects where correctness of lazy route detection outweighs rebuild speed, please consider using AOT mode for development. AOT mode will also provide a full set of template errors as well which JIT mode is not capable of doing.

Fixes #13102
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "revert: fix(@ngtools/webpack): emit lazy routes errors on rebuilds" (#13309)

### Desired functionality

Support for `pnpm` as a `packageManager` option (along with `yarn`, etc). This will allow us to use ng commands which manipulate `package.json` (like `ng update`) in our repository which uses `pnpm`'s workspace features (so `npm install` won't work). Because `pnpm` generally provides the same commands as `npm` it should be just a matter of adding it to the schema and using the `pnpm` executable instead of the `npm` one when so configured.

Issues.Title: OverlayRed 'updatePositionStrategy' does not remove offsets
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
When calling `updatePositionStrategy` The previous strategy must be completely removed.

#### What is the current behavior?
The `offset` value of a position `flexibleConnectedTo` does not get removed when the position strategy gets updated.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

Issues.Title: build: run e2e tests with bazel
Issues.Body:
* Builds the e2e app with Bazel
* Serves the e2e app with Bazel
* Switches e2e tests completely to `async/await`. The promise manager from Selenium has been removed in the latest version. See https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/2969
* Runs the e2e tests with Bazel protractor rules

---

**Note**: This already simplifies our setup a lot and also makes it easier for people to run e2e tests locally also w/ AOT. 

I want to speed up these e2e tests in a follow-up by moving them into individual `web_tests` rather than into a suite. This enables better concurrency

Issues.Title: Mat-menu keyboard accessibility breaks when mat-menu-item is hidden
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
When hidden item is used in mat-menu then focus should not go to that item.
If hidden field is used then while navigation it should skip that item and focus on next visible item.

#### What is the current behavior?

Currently if hidden item is used in mat-menu  then user need to press Down Arrow key two times to reach on next visible item

In below example user needs to press **DOWN ARROW** two time to reach on item4 from item2.
`
<mat-menu #menu="matMenu">
  <button mat-menu-item>Item 1</button>
  <button mat-menu-item>Item 2</button>
  <button mat-menu-item style="display:none">Item 3</button>
  <button mat-menu-item>Item 4</button>
  <button mat-menu-item>Item 5</button>
</mat-menu>
`
#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-mat-menu-accessibility-issue

Open above link and follow below steps
1. Enter on menu button
2. Observe behavior on item2 when you press DOWN ARROW key, you will find you need to press key two time to reach on item4 as item3 is hidden.
 


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7+

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Mat-menu keyboard accessibility breaks when mat-menu-item is hidden" (#14653)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): unable to move item into connected container by passing through another container
Issues.Body:
Fixes not being able to move an item from one container into another by passing it through an intermediate container that isn't connected to the final one. The issue comes from the fact that the way things are set up at the moment, the container from which the item started the sequence knows which containers it can go into, however all that knowledge is reset once the item enters into a different container. These changes rework the logic to have the individual containers know whether the item can enter into them and have the source container "ask" each of its siblings whether the item can enter.

Fixes #14645.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): unable to move item into connected container by passing through another container" (#14651)

Issues.Title: Make an overlay always on top of other overlays
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.

whenever a new overlay is created it is positions on top of other existing overlays (speaking wrt z-index).
provide a way to mark a overlay need to be shown always on top of other overlay's irrespective of order of creation

 
#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?

In our application we are using `overlay` as container for in-app **notifications** (we don't use/follow material spec)
We also use overlay for different use-cases like `full-window` dialogs, custom `drop-downs` , and such things
opening new overlay is hiding the **notifications** which we do not want
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Make an overlay always on top of other overlays" (#14650)
